Micki WagnerCommerce Writer

I cover everything kitchen-related, from cookware and countertop appliances to pantry staples and cleaning and organizing must-haves. I’m based in New York, NY.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Even though I love cooking, I have never enjoyed grocery shopping. I usually do it in person, and I nearly always find it stressful. Given that I shop in cramped New York City stores, there are always too many people and there’s too much noise. And usually, something I need is out of stock — whether that’s a specific herb, a type of cheese, or a cut of meat. So if there’s a way to skip the store or cut down on the amount of time I’m spending in there, I’ll take it.

Thankfully, there is one way I can cross some items off my list right from the comfort of my own home. Editor-loved brand Good Chop allows you to get high-quality meats, poultry, seafood, and more delivered right to your doorstep. And even better? You can get a serious discount on your first few boxes this Presidents’ Day!

What Is Good Chop?

Sure, you can buy meat from the grocery store, but you could also let Good Chop do the work for you, and it’s guaranteed to be top-tier (which might not always be the case at the grocery store). Good Chop is a subscription service that brings your favorite meats right to your door. There are three plans you can choose from: Medium, Large, and Extra Large, which all allow you to choose half a dozen or more cuts of meat. You can opt for everything from steaks to ground meat to chicken to wild-caught seafood.

Plus, you can choose to get deliveries every month, every six weeks, or every two months, depending on what works best for your lifestyle and cooking habits. And if you want to take a break from your deliveries, you totally can. Or if you need to cancel, you can do so as soon as five days before your next box is due to arrive. Easy peasy! 

All of Good Chop’s meat comes directly from the U.S., and the brand boasts that it hasn’t changed the price of its base plan since it was founded four years ago. And speaking of pricing, you can currently get discounts on each of your first three boxes, totaling $110 in savings! 

Good Chop also happens to be a favorite brand of ours. “Obviously, the biggest metric of a meat delivery service is the product — and Good Chop delivers (both literally and figuratively),” our tester wrote in his review. “Every cut I cooked was fresh and delicious, with great color and delicious flavor. And, the variety of options meant I was cooking and eating different meats nearly every night, so I never got bored.”

If you’re someone who loves a restaurant-quality steak or salmon filet, you can’t go wrong with Good Chop’s delivery service. Not only is it super convenient and time-saving, but there’s also a wide variety of options to choose from, so you can add some variety to your weekly dinners.

Buy: Good Chop, starting at $99 (normally $149)
